title: Memoirs of the life of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Lockhart, J. G.
snippet: Shortly after resuming his chair, Sir Walter (I am told) sent a slip of paper to Mr. Robertson, begging him to "confess something too, — why not the murder of Begbie?" (See ante Vol. III. p. 260.) But if Peter complied with the hint, it was long after the senior dignitaries  had left the room.
